column4: Help I can't install a package! log file details here: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/25624/
why are you trying to install this package?
does it provide a somehow better version of the libntp package you already have installed?
Why are you checkinstalling? You already have a .deb backage.
could you please paste the output of dpkg -l libnjb5 | grep ii
you seem to be upgrading. If you're using checkinstall to build from source, specify the "name" to be libnjb5 to do it cleanly and avoid all these problems.
and make sure you specify version to be 2.2.5
no. Run the command "checkinstall". Then when it brings up that screen when it shows you the values, press 2 and enter. Type libnjb5. Press enter.
yes, if "name" is libnjb5 and "version" is 2.2.5, press enter.
view the log. Tell me what it says.
I strongly suggest you run the command from scratch as "sudo checkinstall" rather than just installing the generated package with sudo.
no problem. There is no issue. Just run "sudo checkinstall" right now.
yes you are getting errors, because you're not changing the name to libnjb5 like I told you to.
apt-cache search for those packages.
apt-cache search just searches through the repositories for whatever string you specify.
so if you want a package called bobfred, you would "apt-cache search bobfred" and it would list all the packages with bobfred in name or description.
so when you find the package you want, you "apt-get install <package>" it.
remind me why you're compiling a library you already have again?
but you seem to already have that library installed.
hey thanks for all the help. my mp3 player now says it's connected to the comp, but none of the linux music players realize it's there
yo thanks for the help. we made progress. my mp3 player now says it's connected to something intead of just charging like it's on AC power
I didn't really help much xD
